basics.name: Salvador Echeveste
basics.label: Robotics/Mechatronics Lecturer | ML Research Engineer
basics.summary: PhD researcher with 5+ years developing probabilistic ML models for noisy time-series data. Expert in Bayesian optimization, uncertainty quantification, and signal processing with proven ability to extract signals from high-frequency (1.7kHz) streams and 4GB+ datasets.

work.name: University of Illinois at Chicago - Robotics & Motion Lab
work.summary: Leading research in Bayesian optimization, EMG time-series modeling, and control systems for hip exoskeleton applications
highlights: Bayesian optimization for controller tuning (hip exoskeleton system): heteroscedastic Gaussian Processes (ARD Matérn 5/2), EHVI, and Pareto analysis for multi-objective formulations with input-dependent noise
EMG time-series modeling: Hankel decomposition, truncated SVD, and Bayesian-regularized Koopman regression; real-time EMG processing with sub-millisecond latency
Predictive modeling: elastic net feature selection; Akima interpolation for data synthesis; classification of optimal controller classes from anthropometrics
Control systems: adaptive impedance control, Bézier stiffness profiles, finite state machines; real-time deployment at 100 Hz on hip exoskeleton hardware
Statistics & data: bootstrap confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, ICC reliability; SQL-based pipeline across a 4 GB/360-trial dataset; EMG-based cost function development

projects.summary: Designed adaptive filtering algorithms using Hankel trajectory reconstruction with truncated SVD and Bayesian-regularized Koopman regression
